TextBlock.Text: DAZ: My love, I am immensely relieved by my discovery on Timber Hearth - and simultaneously, deeply perplexed by it.

DAZ: Like the <color=orange>orcnids</color> we observed, the native lifeforms of Timber Hearth appear to be in perfectly stable condition. They continue to swim happily in the subterrenean cave pools.
CASSAVA: Truly..? Oh, gratitude, powers above... Though we have lost much, we may at least find comfort in the safety of these species.
CASSAVA: However, I imagine we share a common question in our minds. Why were these lifeforms unaffected by the horror that has invaded this star system?
DAZ: There is.. another exception, my love: The two of us. I do not believe this to be coincidence.
DAZ: Hypothesis: the <color=orange>deadly matter</color> that has invaded the star system may be <color=orange>unable to penetrate water.</color>

CASSAVA: This property would explain why only lifeforms submerged by water were able to survive its arrival and continued presence.. A cyclone approaches; I shall wait on the high cliffs to test your brilliant hypothesis, love!

CASSAVA: An update: The deadly matter appears to be cleansed <color=orange>in contact with water!</color> My third eye observed the matter resting on the beach neutralizing as Lovers' Cove plunged back into the waves.
CASSAVA: However, this effect was incredibly brief and fleeting. Upon the waves settling, the deadly matter immediately rejuvenated its presence around the island..
DAZ: I shall voyage to Lovers' Cove to join you soon, my love. I wish to learn more about the nature of this matter in the time we have left.. Perhaps work will distract us from our grief.
